title: Neil deGrasse Tyson Doesn't Let His Phone Control Him; The astrophysicist and author of the forthcoming "Starry Messenger: Cosmic Perspectives on Civilization," 63, shares what's on his phone.
text:
Most-surprising apps you depend on

SkyView: shows what you're looking at in the night sky. Merlin: listens to birdsongs and identifies what kind of bird is singing.

Siri user?

Nope. I don't like using my voice unnecessarily. And when I do, I want a person or a pet to be listening.

Most-watched app

YES Network. A longtime Yankee fan.

Preferred Instagram feeds

The New Yorker comics. National Geographic.

Go-to podcast

Making Sense with Sam Harris. Smart, thoughtful people, in deep conversation about socially and culturally relevant topics, in search of resolutions to conflict in the world.

Phone battery percentage at which you feel compelled to charge

Less than 10 percent. But I don't feel nervous. The state of my iPhone draws no emotions from me. I just pull out a charging battery from my backpack, which is highly loaded with all manner of survival items, and I don't miss a beat.

Most-listened-to artist

Blues guitarist Buddy Guy.

Favorite emoji

I try always to use words instead of pictures to express my emotions. But I willuse my thumbs-up emoji in response to an agreed-upon plan in a text exchange. Never in an email.

Cities listed in weather app

New York City; East Hampton, NY; Saratoga Springs, NY; North Salem, NY; Fairbanks, AK; Detroit; London; Chicago; Carlsbad, CA.

Biggest time-wasting app

The phone doesn't control me in this way.
